result.execSummary:
The defendant Francisco Javier Chavez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Bail to apply, remainder to be returned to whoever posted it.

Provide a DNA sample and pay all appropriate costs.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with firearms.
The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

Defendant to have an AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with controlled
substances, except for those prescribed by a physician.
Successfully complete any counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Francisco Javier Chavez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment is denied. tf
filed and distributed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. mag
Original Transcript (20 pages) commencing 08-21-2015 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Francisco Javier Chavez in court with attorney Andrew Rider.  Attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.

    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 63 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 3 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 27 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 MONTHS with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
     *Defendant to participate in Batterer's Treatment.
     *Defendant to have an AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment.
     *  Maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with controlled
        substances, except for those prescribed by a physician.
     *  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
         and supervision fees as determined by
         the Department of Corrections. Bail to apply, remainder to be returned to whoever posted it.
     *  No contact with firearms.
     *No contact with victim.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges 
         are suspended during the length of this sentence. 
         Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment signed by
          the defendant and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.
     *  Provide a DNA sample and pay all
        appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
The defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Defendant remanded.

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, but Read In.
AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored and will have to provide a DNA sample. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Francisco Javier Chavez in court with attorney Andrew Rider. Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rider has taken over as counsel in this matter. Case set for a Plea Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution of this matter.
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 1 Amended to REMOVE the Repeater enhancer (939.62(1)(b)).  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Francisco Javier Chavez in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court, defendant Francisco Javier Chavez not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced from Waukesha County. Court found CAUSE for adjournment, case adjourned to branch 23 for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.O.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Francisco Javier Chavez in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Defendant Francisco Javier Chavez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Quash Bench Warrant received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Francisco Javier Chavez not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
